website_summaries.verdict: This kit helps you build a nice-sized rocket that goes a good distance.
pros: Designed to shoot more than 1,600 feet
Includes a streamer to help you recover the rocket after launch
A good low-priced rocket to give a beginner a thrill
Does not take very long to assemble
cons: This rocket can shoot high, but does not have a recovery parachute to help it land safely

customer_reviews.title: Hi-Flier fly high
customer_reviews.text: These suckers can really fly. They can fly so high, the folks in the ISS say, "Dang, that's a good model rocket." Full discretion though, assembly required. Use contact cement for most of it, not super glue. Otherwise you'll be walking around with half a rocket glued to your hand most of the day. Streamers are the best, not parachutes. Parachutes make the rocket fall back to earth so much slower. Spray paint works great.
customer_reviews.author: Frequency JonesTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: One and done
customer_reviews.text: Good looking rocket, but I’ve launched it 3 different times, three different days. Each landing busts a fin off. Only using the A8-3 engines. The instructions provide you with a pad of putty to pack into the nose cone. I used it all. Waaaaayyy too much, too heavy. The last launch buried the nose in the dirt. Only a streamer to slow the decent. Nose cone is glued shut or I’d remove most of the putty.
customer_reviews.author: Xanbo

customer_reviews.title: Not made to last
customer_reviews.text: I just attempted to assemble this for my 9 year old cub scout last night... it was way more complicated than the Quest model I had purchased last year, but unfortunately after that one's second launch we lost sight of it and never found it again. This model was very difficult to follow the instructions and the fins are suppose to stay on with just a little glue!! I'm not sure they will still be on when we get home today let alone after one or two launches!
customer_reviews.author: Pam A.

customer_reviews.title: Practice makes perfect
customer_reviews.text: Good price. I love these little rockets. Wish they had more, I would have bought several. They fly so high they often get lost. These are great for beginners and learning the tips and tricks to advancing to the next levels of more complex and higher dollar rockets. Practice makes perfect and I like to do it with this rocket.
customer_reviews.author: DDF

customer_reviews.title: So durable once assembled properly
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned at first because it was a bit tough to put together. Once I got it assembled properly, and I launched this with my young niece and nephew, it held up so much better than more expensive model rockets. I was able to use it over and over, even though I didn’t use a parachute. It held its own despite falling close to 1000 feet with C engines.
customer_reviews.author: Josh N

customer_reviews.title: Nicely designed rocket kit.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and slim design should reach high altitudes. Easy (and fun) to build once you've collected the other materials you need (scissors, cellophane tape, plastic glue, white glue, pencil, paints and small paintbrush.) Just like when I was a teenager except I won't be launching it from the street in front of my house! Got a free launch permit from my town's fire department to launch from the larger city parks.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Wullschleger

customer_reviews.title: Garbage materials and tiny
customer_reviews.text: I bought on a wim this for my son since he was so upset he lost his other rocket. I'm really disappointed how tiny this thing is. I didnt realize what I was getting. Hardly worth $10 for a few tiny cardboard tubes and a streamer. This is why I've started building our own rockets. Maybe my son will enjoy losing this one as well.
customer_reviews.author: Xanous

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble. Fun rocket adventures
customer_reviews.text: My boys and I built a couple of these up and even my 10 year old was able to assemble with minimal dad supervision. After blasting it off a few times with an A-series engine, I stepped up to a C6-7 and ... well... it's either up in orbit with SpaceX or it landed in another county. It shot off so fast and so high that it went into the clouds and we never saw it again.
customer_reviews.author: Dj

customer_reviews.title: Building this with my 10 year old Grand daughter
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old grand daughter and I have been building and launching rockets for a couple of years. I am a retired science teacher who had an after school program for years where students build and launched rockets. It is a great hands on experience for young people.,
customer_reviews.author: James. Backus

customer_reviews.title: Great for starters!
customer_reviews.text: Great rocket! Not too hard to build for youngsters, but it can start to give kids the feeling of "building your own rocket", as it has some minor wood cutouts and such for kids to glue. It is a great gateway for anyone who wants to get into model rocketry!
customer_reviews.author: Cormac

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my son,and he loved it! He spends a lot of time flying his model rockets! Quick shipping time!!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Syposs Litz

customer_reviews.title: Good Rocket, but Vague Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Good rockets, but the instructions were vague. I had to find a video online to clarify the assembly process. If you get stuck search this rocket on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: Gecko T

customer_reviews.title: Flies awesome
customer_reviews.text: Rocket flies awesome. I believe this rocket is so awesome I think it achieved orbital status. Launched it, and never saw it again. I recommend using a smaller motor to keep it earthbound.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great rocket
customer_reviews.text: These fly very high, so be sure to be in a VERY open space. Wind will blow it for a long time once shoot is open and it will drift very far. We tend to lose these after one- or two launches. But the cost isn't much so not a huge loss... besides time to build.
customer_reviews.author: AJM1555

customer_reviews.title: Good for a 12 year old first timer rocketeer
customer_reviews.text: I dislike that a rig is needed to correctly position the fins,when glueing into place. Decals were difficult to remove from decal sheet. Ended up not using them. The lack of specific instructions as to using the smaller and bigger engines that this specific rocket .used. Needs better description as to ease of assembly, physical specifications should be more detailed
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Ines

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Went so high, disappeared into the clouds and I never found it. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Rocket works great
customer_reviews.text: Just like when I was a kid. This rocket is awesome! Goes hundreds of feet and had a blast with my son.
customer_reviews.author: Matt C

customer_reviews.title: A fun, "quick" (only a few minutes worth of glueing
customer_reviews.text: A fun, "quick" (only a few minutes worth of glueing, though curing time and painting increases the time significantly) rocket to build. I flew it with a C6-5 and nearly lost it because it goes way up there!
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Good product for a Boy Scout
customer_reviews.text: My son used this for his Boy Scout rocket outing. He enjoyed it, but does taking at least 2 days to assemble due to multiple things needing to be glued and allowing drying time
customer_reviews.author: Scott McCluskey

customer_reviews.title: parts is parts
customer_reviews.text: Got a bag of parts. Less than I'd hoped for. Not worth returning so I gave it away.
customer_reviews.author: S. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner rocket
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner rocket, great quality, great instructions, easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: B. Burn

customer_reviews.title: Estes Hi-Flier Flying Model Rocket Kit - A fun one
customer_reviews.text: love it and it flies super high with the C-6 , but as with balsa wood and no chute we have broken a couple wings landing this one. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Ali

customer_reviews.title: Ok for one day
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy but my son had fun with it for one day
customer_reviews.author: Christina Ogea

customer_reviews.title: Got this for my son for his Rocketry merit badge
customer_reviews.text: This rocket was small, but boy it flew high! We launched it with a C5 engine and wow!
customer_reviews.author: Brian B.

customer_reviews.title: Great rocket - not easy to assemble, but a great kit!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 9YO son to put together for a Cub Scout rocket launching party. Took myself and him close to 4 hours to put the thing together, and then another hour to prime & paint it. Definetly not for the newbie, but it flew great, and came back in one(well two) pieces. Highly recommend to anyone who wants to build and customize rockets as a hobby, maybe 10+
customer_reviews.author: S. Martineau

customer_reviews.title: Rocket
customer_reviews.text: Have flown this little rocket many times! It’ll get out of sight quick! May want to add a parachute to it or a large streamer.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rocket
customer_reviews.text: hi, I have had this rocket for a long time 18 launches still is fine easy to build and flew fine. there is no parachute its a bright orange streamer still has never broken its worth the money 100%. you need to buy a launch pad and engines it takes A-C sizes I would buy this if I were you.
customer_reviews.author: Oreo

customer_reviews.title: I’d recommend packing it with a parachute though or else recover ...
customer_reviews.text: This rocket was incredible! Holy moly did it take tf off!!! I’d recommend packing it with a parachute though or else recover probably won’t be an option. It REALLY takes off!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Not thorough enough instructions
customer_reviews.text: Nice kit but a little difficult for a first timer instructions could use some work
customer_reviews.author: Will Rytt

customer_reviews.title: Good and worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: Really nice! Shot the first try and did well for my physics class project
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Really cheap and fell apart before was even able to launch
customer_reviews.author: Soozett

customer_reviews.title: Model flying rocket
customer_reviews.text: Instructions not good hard to put together don’t tell you what engine to use
customer_reviews.author: Chance R

customer_reviews.title: Where'd it go?
customer_reviews.text: It's a great rocket! I've bought two of them. I've never got one back. So you get one back you didn't build it right. PS parachute increases risk of loss..
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Its good. Be sure to check the product dimensions or ...
customer_reviews.text: Its good. Be sure to check the product dimensions or look at it in a picture next to other things. Looking at just the picture of the rocket with nothing else doesn't give a feel for its actual size.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Do no think it’s anything like the pictures in amazon
customer_reviews.text: stop... reconsider looking elsewhere.. I have never seen a cheaper made rocket.. a quarter of the size, no stickers to make it look like the web page.... no parachute, cheap and generic.need to paint.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for teens could be used for fun or even an at home/homeschooling learning experiment....
customer_reviews.author: mjsmommie333

customer_reviews.title: HIGH FLYER FOR SURE!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT LITTLE ROCKET. IT REALLY IS A HIGH FLYER! IT WENT SO HIGH WITH LARGE ENGINE THAT I LOST TRACK OF IT AND LOST AFTER FIRST LAUNCH. COOL LITTLE ROCKET THOUGH AND EASY TO BUILD
customer_reviews.author: Big Todd

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does not come with a parachute. This rocket is a one and done rocket. Bought it for Boy Scouts.
customer_reviews.author: David R Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Fun fun fun
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a friends kids birthday and we had so much fun building and launching them. You have to buy the engines and wadding and launch pad but if this is something you want to do, buy a bulk package and go have fun.
customer_reviews.author: Danniboi

customer_reviews.title: It flew perfectly and the directions were so easy a kid could have made this.
customer_reviews.text: I know what I ordered, but I felt that the fins were too thin. I think I should have ordered something more expensive to have been more happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Hans

customer_reviews.title: ... my 23 year old boyfriend to make and he LOVED it. Really easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my 23 year old boyfriend to make and he LOVED it. Really easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: rachel warhover

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: Only, the issue i had, is that: Assembly and fixing wings on side is little difficult.
customer_reviews.author: gusi

customer_reviews.title: Lol thx China
customer_reviews.text: It's a lot smaller than I thought missing parts ended up in the trash
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Keys

customer_reviews.title: Hi- Flier is RIGHT!
customer_reviews.text: Hi-Flier is right! If you use the largest rocket engine suggested, you will almost loose sight of this Hi-Flier. A fairly easy build that is well worth the time.
customer_reviews.author: D S Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Start to finish project
customer_reviews.text: Slightly smaller than I had anticipated, and we had to put the entire rocket together including paint. That is why the price seemed too good to be true.
customer_reviews.author: R. Moretti

customer_reviews.title: arrived in good order. students had a great time and learned ...
customer_reviews.text: purchased for student projects in a class I teach. arrived in good order. students had a great time and learned a good bit about being accurate during assembly
customer_reviews.author: Alan W Hollaway

customer_reviews.title: Dont was
customer_reviews.text: Literally the WORST instructions I’ve ever seen. Nothing but misleading pictures!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pelkey

customer_reviews.title: my son loved it. made 18 launches before my son and ...
customer_reviews.text: my son loved it . made 18 launches before my son and i lost it in 4mph wind .this thing goes out of sight with c-7 you don't see it until about 1000 ft or so i would add a wider streamer and paint it a brighter color next time around
customer_reviews.author: mckenna

customer_reviews.title: so much fun to set off
customer_reviews.text: so much fun to set off. although I did not know I would be gluing it together. Thought it was more of a snap thing
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: Damaged en route. Poor packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Rocket tube smashed. The rocket was only eight dollars and change, so I'm going to attempt to build it but it's never going to fly straight. Very disappointing. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Trixie Baggins

customer_reviews.title: Success
customer_reviews.text: It was used as a 4H project, it was a great project.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Small High Flyer
customer_reviews.text: Use a C6-5 motor in this little rocket and set some height records. It comes with a white tube and cap, and the fins are raw balsa wood. Paint, sanding and glue are needed.
customer_reviews.author: James N Houck

customer_reviews.title: No Parachute! Most Estes rockets come with parachutes so ...
customer_reviews.text: No Parachute! Most Estes rockets come with parachutes so they are reusable after they crash land. However, this one only comes with a streamer so that you can locate it in the sky. That will not slow down your rocket as it falls. Please look for a rocket that comes with a parachute so you are not wasting your money on a one time launch rocket.
customer_reviews.author: Matthies3

customer_reviews.title: Total garbage. Very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of you know what. Total garbage. Very flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: k.m.r.j. Connelly

customer_reviews.title: Made our 11yo nephew very happy
customer_reviews.text: He's addicted. Fairly easy to assemble with adult help. Fairly easy to recover. Find a big field on a calm day though as this one goes high!
customer_reviews.author: Haverhill

customer_reviews.title: Rockets made a great memory for my grand-kids of something their parents enjoyed ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything arrived just a couple of days before Christmas. Rockets made a great memory for my grand-kids of something their parents enjoyed as kids.
customer_reviews.author: linda thompson

customer_reviews.title: Made it with my daughter and was a fun project with her (age 7)
customer_reviews.text: Simple but very lightweight rocket. Made it with my daughter and was a fun project with her (age 7), we used CA glue and painted it lightly. I tried 3 estes motors and found they were unreliable due to inadequate igniters, I had a pack of Quest motors, and it worked first try, unfortunately it was a c6-0 motor and it went straight up into the clouds never to be seen again, even with no wind. We were impressed by the launch and it was worth one launch, multiple cars stopped at the road to watch it go up due to large smoke plume.
customer_reviews.author: Customer3641

customer_reviews.title: Rocket Science
customer_reviews.text: Hard to assemble for little kid and potentiall frustrating to adults.
customer_reviews.author: J.L.PAR

customer_reviews.title: Simple to build and flew great for a beginner rocket
customer_reviews.text: Simple to build and flew great for a beginner rocket. Great project for my 5 year old daughter and I. You can't beat the price either. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Eff

customer_reviews.title: This isn't quite as easy to assemble as it would seem - there is ...
customer_reviews.text: This isn't quite as easy to assemble as it would seem - there is a lot of gluing and cutting involved.
customer_reviews.author: slapshot136

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a school project for my son. Worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Susana

customer_reviews.title: Hmmmmmmm We will have fun with it though
customer_reviews.text: For some reason... with how high this one flies, I thought it would be bigger? Hmmmmmmm We will have fun with it though.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to its name!
customer_reviews.text: The hi-flyer lives up to its name, a bit too well! I put it together so carefully and painted it this cool yellow on black pattern. Just after the paint dried I ran out to the field to launch it. We did a few test launches on a different low flying rocket, just to get a sense of the wind conditions. It was dead calm. Unable to constrain myself I loaded a C6 and launched. I barely saw it go up, and never saw it again. Great model and a real thrill, just don't put too much effort into it!
customer_reviews.author: S.B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beginning Rocketry Work
customer_reviews.text: The Estes 2178 Hi- Flier is a rocket kit which the students in my science clubs love assembling and launching.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly J. McNeill

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner rocket!
customer_reviews.text: I must second the "Find a big field" posts -- almost lost it on my first launch when the wind drifted it over a fence. Was able to recover, but went and found a big field and launched it with C engines. Super fun. This rocket got me into the hobby, and I have now assembled 3 other rockets (most recent a 2-stager that I'm still painting and hoping to launch this weekend. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Many successful launches.
customer_reviews.text: My son and I launched the high flyer several times using both A and B model engines. It is a simple basic rocket, but for our first experience with the hobby it worked well. We are looking forward to getting some other rockets.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron More

customer_reviews.title: Defective nose cone
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a great rocket but I didn't realize the nose cone was defective until one day after it was too late to return. I received a factory defect with a melted cone which doesn't seem very aerodynamic.
customer_reviews.author: Gizmo guy

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Quick, and Unfortunately Defective
customer_reviews.text: Rocket assembly was incredibly quick and easy! The style of the rocket looks amazing and I'm sure it would fly over 1000' except for one problem. The motor mounting tube diameter is too small to fit A,B, or C motors. I tried to make my motors fit but the simply were too wide and deformed the tube. I assume it was a manufacturing defect with my particular kit; however, it's still disappointing I'm able to launch my rocket.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: High high micro flyer
customer_reviews.text: Easy build. Fun to paint and launch. Definitely use suggested engine for first launch to make sure everything works. My second launch with c65 engine sent this about 4seconds beyond what I could see... Ended up flying all the way across my school campus
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: it was just what I expected, smaller than you probably think. but it worked great for my purposes. so yeah.
customer_reviews.author: L. Neff

customer_reviews.title: One of our favorites
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little rocket. Simple construction, easy to build. We have launched it about ten times and it's definitely one of our favorites. It travels very fast and very high with a C engine. For the price it's worth adding to your collection.
customer_reviews.author: FlipTopBox

customer_reviews.title: Eh.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cheap. You get what you pay for.. also, you have to paint this the color you want and assemble. Does not even come with a red base. Got 1 use out of it before it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Williams

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build and flies great
customer_reviews.text: This is my first rocket model and the instructions were easy to follow. I did cheat by going on youtube as well, which I recommend if you are more of the visual type. The first test flight was great.
customer_reviews.author: Martale

customer_reviews.title: could be good
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived with a slightly bent tube so the packaging could have been better. I recommend having a fin aligner for assembly. I made these away from my house and my estimated fin alignment caused me to lose a lot of altitude at launch.
customer_reviews.author: colorado13

customer_reviews.title: Great Results on launch day!
customer_reviews.text: Easy first time rocket to build for my 11 year old son, great results on launch day too. Did not disappoint, he now wants to build more rockets! We went out to Plaster City, CA with his scout troop. His rocket performed as indicated in the instructions. No wind, flew high and straight, chute deployed perfectly. Able to launch and recover 7 times! Brought it home and will replace the chute, it will be good as new! Thanks, Estes!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Munson

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ROCKET
customer_reviews.text: I USED TO DO THESE AS A KID AND I HAVE BEEN WANTING TO GET BACK INTO IT WITH MY GRANDKIDS SHOULD BE FUN!!
customer_reviews.author: NanW

customer_reviews.title: Model Rocket
customer_reviews.text: It's a great minor project to do with someone. Originally I thought it was going to be a breeze, but I soon realized that I needed a sharp exacto knife and some good crazy glue. Although the directions mention using wood glue, I decided to use crazy glue and it worked just as good, but you must be precise and clear in where you are going to set the pieces, because once you apply the crazy glue, it's hard to remove and replace if the piece is misaligned.
customer_reviews.author: Amir Chapel

customer_reviews.title: Assembly was a pain because the directions were terrible. If you are REALLY into building these
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was a pain because the directions were terrible. If you are REALLY into building these, you might be okay.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: No engine clip
customer_reviews.text: No engine clip which was annoying, this caused the engine to blow itself out rather than deploying the recovery system, because of the weighted nose the rocket free fell and imbedded itself about four inches into frozen ground. Don't know if I got a faulty kit or if the problem is wide spread. Other than that, it was great!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Hills

customer_reviews.title: First flight with the A engine went perfect. 2nd flight a few days later with the ...
customer_reviews.text: First flight with the A engine went perfect. 2nd flight a few days later with the C engine and it disappeared into the clouds never to be seen again. My son thinks it's in space. Ordering another one.
customer_reviews.author: Jamison Garland

customer_reviews.title: Stick with the Athena
customer_reviews.text: I was not real happy with this kit as it had very poor quality material in it. I have literally built and used hundreds of different models and this one just didn't impress me. My advice go with the Athena model by Estes and you will be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Description is very misleading. You can’t do a single ...
customer_reviews.text: Description is very misleading. You can’t do a single thing with what is included, not to mention, it is cheaply manufactured and I was missing at least one piece
customer_reviews.author: MClair

customer_reviews.title: not happy
customer_reviews.text: very cheap looking, we didn't even use it for my grandson's project. I was very unhappy with the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Can you find this rocket ?? NO
customer_reviews.text: This little bugar flies so high on c-5 engines, we built, painted and shot off 2 -- never found them.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Read fine print
customer_reviews.text: The rocket was easy to assemble but wish it actually came with engine. No where in description did it state engine not included. Don't assume because you are buying a kit that it contains everything needed 😠
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: waste of money-doesnt have all pieces needed to complete it.
customer_reviews.text: SERIOUSLY! Instructions show additional supplies needed: scissors, pencil, ruler, carpenters glue, modeling knife, plastic cement, primer (white) spray paint (red, black, grey), clear coat, masking tape, fine sand paper, silver 1/32 pin stripe tape, silver paint pen. why didn't any other review say this! very disappointing when my 8 year old tried to build this gift. horrible! fyi, product came on, time great packaging.
customer_reviews.author: brooklyngal

product_meta.title: Estes Hi-Flier Flying Model Rocket Kit
feature_bullets: Be sure and keep your eye on this stream-lined missile as it climbs to amazing heights over 1,600 feet, and recovers with a fluorescent orange streamer
One of our most extreme, super performance model rockets you can own and can easily be built in one afternoon
Kit features laser cut wood fins, self-stick decals, streamer recovery
Estes model rocketry is recommended for ages 10 and up with adult supervision for those under 12
Tools, construction and finishing supplies sold separately. In order to launch, a launch system, model rocket engines, starters and recovery wadding are required - sold separately
